intro: Sonderina streyi, commonly known as the desert star cactus, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of South America. It features a short, cylindrical stem covered in dense, white spines that provide protection from herbivores and reduce water loss. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, blooming during the cooler months. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it stores water in its stem for survival in harsh environments. Sonderina streyi is well adapted to extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
